DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the chronic lymphocytic leukemia symptoms.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The most common type of chronic lymphoid leukemia, and comprises 90% of chronic lymphoid leukemias in the United States.  Morphologically, the neoplastic cells are small, round B-lymphocytes.  The clinical course is indolent, but this type of leukemia is not considered to be curable with available therapy. (WHO, 2001) -- 2003_An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Unexplained weight loss of greater than 10 percent of body weight in six months before treatment; unexplained fever greater than 38 degrees celcius; or, night sweats.
None of the following: Unexplained weight loss of greater than 10 percent of body weight in six months before treatment; unexplained fever greater than 38 degrees celcius; or, night sweats.
Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

ReferenceDocuments.description: What were the chronic lymphocytic leukemia symptoms?

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping for CDE:3128032
ReferenceDocuments.description: PerformedObservationResult.value [symptom] WHERE PerformedObservationResult [symptom] > AssessResultRelationship > PerformedObservation [assessment] > DefinedObservation.nameCode = "assess symptoms for possible diagnosis" AND PerformedObservation [assessment] > PerformfedDiagnosis.value = "lymphocytic leukemia"
